capsules_submitted.utterance: So Vernon has a car, that's confirmed. I'm pretty sure about it. It's not like he doesn't have one, because that would be weird for him to own something and not have it, right?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon's car is his most prized possession, and I can see why he'd want to keep it safe. He's always been a bit of a sentimental person when it comes to material things, and that car holds a lot of memories for him.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and sometimes dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating, but at the same time, he has a certain depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.
capsules_submitted.reply: this is news to me. i didn't know that you're a guy, valeria!

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and sometimes dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating, but at the same time, he has a certain depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is quite a misconception. I mean, have you seen his backstory? He was a victim of bullying and abuse himself, which makes him all the more relatable. But at the same time, his harsh exterior does hide a certain vulnerability.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia's lineage is quite interesting. I've been studying the maculogy of this particular plant, and it seems that its unique markings are a result of its specific genetic makeup. As far as I know, petunias can be prone to certain health issues if their lineage isn't properly maintained, but with proper care, they can thrive.
